display.label: Shopify
display.description: Manage customers, products, and orders in your Shopify platform

connections.label: Shopify OAuth 2.0
connections.comments: Authenticate requests to Shopify using values obtained from the Developer Console.

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for Shopify
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for Shopify
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: A space-delimited set of one or more scopes to get the user's permission to access. A list of all scopes is available at https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes#authenticated-access-scopes
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Obtain this by creating an app at https://partners.shopify.com/
inputs.label: API Key

inputs.comments: Obtain this by creating an app at https://partners.shopify.com/
inputs.label: API Secret

inputs.comments: The domain of your Shopify platform, without the https://
inputs.label: Host

documentation.description:
The Shopify component authenticates requests through a OAuth 2.0 credential.
Information on how to generate an OAuth 2.0 app with Shopify can be found [in their documentation](https://shopify.dev/apps/auth/oauth)

Now, you will have to configure OAuth 2.0 settings in Prismatic.
Create a new Shopify connection of type **OAuth 2.0**.

-   Enter the **API Key** and **API Secret** that you got from the Shopify developer dashboard.
-   For **Scopes** choose from the list found on the [Shopify documentation](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/access-scopes#authenticated-access-scopes)

inputs.comments: Generate from the 'API credentials' tab of a private Shopify app that you own
inputs.label: Admin API Access Token

inputs.comments: The domain of your Shopify platform, without the https://
inputs.label: Host

documentation.description:
An **admin API access token** can be used for testing purposes as you develop your integration.
You can create an access token from the **API credentials** tab of a private Shopify app that you create.

Before publishing an integration for customers, we recommend you switch to OAuth 2.0 authentication to give your users a single button-click experience.

display.label: Create Webhook
display.description: Creates a webhook for the desired topic in your Shopify store

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the topic you would like to point your webhook at. You can chose from the list found in the Shopify docs: https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-rest/2023-04/resources/webhook#event-topics
inputs.label: Webhook Topic

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the URL the newly created webhook will post to. You can use this input to configure your Shopify trigger.
inputs.label: Post URL

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the format you would like your webhook to return.
inputs.label: Webhook Format

display.label: Delete Instance Webhooks
display.description: Delete all webhooks related to this instance

display.label: Delete Webhook
display.description: Delete a webhook by ID

inputs.comments: The ID of an existing webhook
inputs.label: Webhook ID

display.label: List Webhooks
display.description: List all webhooks or webhooks for this instance

inputs.comments: Show only webhooks that point to this instance
inputs.label: Show only instance webhooks

display.label: Create Customer
display.description: Create a new customer

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the first name
inputs.label: First Name

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the last name of the customer
inputs.label: Last Name

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the email of the customer
inputs.label: Email

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the phone number of the customer
inputs.label: Phone

inputs.comments: Provide a value for a note on the customer
inputs.label: Notes

inputs.comments: This flag will enable emails to be sent to the customer.
inputs.label: Verified Email

inputs.comments: Provide a JSON array containing address objects
inputs.example:
"[
    {
      "id": 1053317299,
      "customer_id": 1073339466,
      "first_name": "Mother",
      "last_name": "Lastnameson",
      "company": null,
      "address1": "123 Oak St",
      "address2": null,
      "city": "Ottawa",
      "province": "Ontario",
      "country": "Canada",
      "zip": "123 ABC",
      "phone": "555-1212",
      "name": "Mother Lastnameson",
      "province_code": "ON",
      "country_code": "CA",
      "country_name": "Canada",
      "default": true
    },
  ]"
inputs.label: Address List

inputs.comments: The names of the fields and their values to use when creating/updating a record. You can use this input to specify the key and value of any property that is not already in Prismatic.
inputs.label: Values

inputs.comments: Provide a valid currency format
inputs.label: Currency Format

inputs.comments: For each list item, provide a string you would like to tag the product with.
inputs.label: Tags

inputs.comments: Determines if the customer is tax exempt.
inputs.label: Tax Exempt

inputs.comments: Provide a JSON array containing metadata objects
inputs.label: Metafields

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Shopify's API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/users/current.json), The base URL is already included (https://YOUR-DOMAIN.myshopify.com/admin/api/API-VERSION). For example, to connect to https://YOUR-DOMAIN.myshopify.com/admin/api/API-VERSION/users/current.json, only /users/current.json is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

inputs.comments: Shopify versions its API. See https://shopify.dev/docs/api/release-notes for a list of available versions.
inputs.label: API Version

display.label: Webhook
display.description: Trigger for handling webhook requests from the Shopify platform

inputs.comments: The Shopify app's client secret, viewable from the Partner Dashboard
inputs.label: Secret Key

documentation.description:
You can configure a Shopify [webhook](https://shopify.dev/apps/webhooks) to send information to a Prismatic webhook URL under certain conditions (a "Customer" is created, a "Order" is shipped, etc.).

A full list of configurable operations is available on the [Shopify Docs](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-rest/2021-10/resources/webhook#top)

[Shopify](https://www.shopify.com/) is a multinational e-commerce company. They offer a subscription-based software that allows anyone to set up an online store and sell their products.
This component allows you to manage the products and customers connected to your Shopify account.
